DOC.brief_summary: To determine arcuate incision perform iFS femtosecond laser safe effective reduce corneal astigmatism .
DOC.brief_title: Safety Effectiveness Arcuate Incisions Performed With iFS Femtosecond Laser System
DOC.detailed_description: Surgeons perform arcuate incision cornea arc segment pattern use iFS femtosecond laser treat subject corneal astigmatism .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Male female , race , least 21 year age time preop exam 2 . Corneal astigmatism , determine topographic keratometry , 0.75 D 4.00 diopter ( D ) 3 . Best Spectacle Corrected Distance Visual Acuity ( BSCVA ) 1 . Group 1 : Natural astigmatism , cataract BSCVA 20/25 good Pre cataract phakic IOL surgery BSCVA criterion 2 . Group 2 : Post IOL surgery BSCVA 20/25 well 4 . Uncorrected Visual Acuity ( UCVA ) 20/40 bad 5 . Demonstration agreement : Corneal astigmatism ( determined topographic keratometry ) must agreement refractive astigmatism ( determine manifest refraction ) within < /= 0.75 D magnitude 15 degree axis cylinder < /= 1.5 D 10 degree axis cylinder > 1.5 D. 6 . Preoperative central pachymetry > /=480 um 7 . Keratometry 38.0 D ( flat ) 48.0 D ( steep ) 8 . Corneal power ( diopter ) difference 3mm point topographic center shall < /= 1D steep meridian 9 . Intraocular pressure 12 21 mm Hg glaucomatous retinal/optic nerve change 10 . Subjects worn contact lens within past 30 day must remove soft lens least 2 week prior rigid toric lens least 3 week prior baseline measurement 11 . Willing capable return followup examination duration study 1 . Angle kappa great 0.5 mm , absolute value 2 . Prior implantation toric multifocal intraocular lens 3 . Women pregnant , breastfeeding , intend become pregnant course study 4 . Concurrent use topical systemic medication may impair corneal wound heal 5 . History ocular medical condition could affect corneal wound heal 6 . History active recurrent ophthalmic disease , include corneal dystrophy nonrefractive abnormality exposure keratitis clinically significant dry eye 7 . Abnormal topography , include evidence keratoconus pellucid marginal degeneration either eye 8 . Evidence clinically significant corneal opacity/scar operative eye ( ) within 8 mm diameter zone visual axis 9 . Known sensitivity inappropriate responsiveness medication use postoperative course 10 . Participation conflict clinical study
